body:
We faced an issue when upgrading temporal from `1.9.2` to the latest with the permissions of `RoleWorker`.

There was a change in behaviour in `defaultAuthorizer` introduced in https://github.com/temporalio/temporal/pull/1711 

It used to grant access by default hence the worker role was effectively writer. With these permissions now more fine grained, the worker role seems a bit redundant. Is it supposed to have any permissions or was this side effect intentional?

comments.body:
Thank for reporting this!
`defaultAuthorizer` is currently incomplete in its support for fine-grain authorization, and is meant more as a sample for custom authorizers. #1711 added support for read-only APIs. But there's no similar list for worker-only APIs yet.
#1711 caused this unintended side effect that if somebody used `RoleWorker`, it was treated as a writer before #1711 and is not anymore after #1711.

title: Clarification about the WorkerRole in defaultAuthorizer
